author: chris2_2_2
content: Off chain payments (aka mev) increased dramatically post 1559 though so I suspect that would alter this graph (but have no idea how it would alter it) if included.

author: butta
content:
Do we expect an increase of gas price post merge? 
Depending on flashbot adoption post merge, the public mempool gas competitions might return

author: butta
content: (and an increase of failed tx)

author: sky.cactus
content: There isn't any strong reason to expect significant changes in gas costs with the merge other than potential changes in usage patterns (which is anyone's guess).

author: potuz
content: I think <@97774605351010304> has a point, miners currently do have a MEV machinery in place and it's rare to see a block with normal ordering. There's no reason to expect that every validator (in particular solo stakers)  will be participating with relays. At least for a while I'd expect many people running the default setup

author: sky.cactus
content: Why do you expect that?

author: butta
content: because mev boost will be a last minute thingy prior to the merge, large operations need implementation time and individual stakers are probably not even aware yet

author: sky.cactus
content: Isn't it already implemented in some clients?

author: sky.cactus
content: (I haven't been following closely)

author: butta
content: not that i am aware of. maybe on kiln?

author: chris2_2_2
content: The average staking pool doesnâ€™t even know mev exists

author: chris2_2_2
content: I canâ€™t say which but one of the largest ones took me for dinner and they had no idea about mev or tips ðŸ˜…

author: potuz
content: because most people run stock geth and do not update their software unless they are told several weeks in advance and repeteadly. Most of our Discord users have no clue about how MEV-Boost will be implemented and we'll be lucky to see if their recipient fee is set correctly instead of the default burn address. Surely big staking pools will be ready to exploit MEV, but I don't expect the same from a dappnode user that bought a box and has only upgraded for Altair.

author: potuz
content: the API hasn't even been finalized and there were still discussions in dev-connect. I sincerely doubt that come the merge, we will be seeing most blocks as today including bundles built by searchers

author: chris2_2_2
content: Itâ€™ll be interesting to see the same apathy and stupidity you see from some  miners carried over to stakers despite the increased money invested. Our biggest support complaint today was why are my earnings higher despite us having an announcement telling everyone they would be due to bigger blocks that tagged everyone.

author: timbeiko
content: I donâ€™t think thatâ€™s true - every pool I have talked to is well aware of it

author: chris2_2_2
content: When did you talk to them? The one I met was a few months ago so maybe they are learning now that the merge is getting closer.

author: timbeiko
content: I regularly talk with a few of them, as well as with the Flashbots team

author: timbeiko
content: I donâ€™t have a very thorough tracking, but it seems like Flashbots is well aware of who they need to reach out to, and what needs to be done to get MEV-boost ready.

author: tokey1475
content: according to this https://dashboard.flashbots.net/, only around 50% of blocks have flashbots bundles, so I'm not sure we need to be worried about the impact on the network if the FB penetration level drops

author: tokey1475
content: anyway it will be an interesting experiment to see how the network performs without it

author: rufusg.
content: ? Do you have another data set?

author: tennisbowling
content:
I asked in the nimbus discord how mev builders would get incentive for providing the service, and got this response
> Builders buys the spot to the validator, and get the reward from the block 
> At least that's my understanding
> So, as a builder, if I manage to build a block with a 1 eth reward to myself, I can buy the spot to the validator for 0.9 eth
> 
> The validator chooses whichever is the most profitable for him
> (figures are obviously fictional) 
just making sure this is true, do we have an estimate of who will run mev builders?
